question:
A museum near your home is looking for people to do part-time voluntary/ 
unpaid work. You would like to do some voluntarylunpaid work at the museum. 
Write a letter to the museum director to apply for the voluntarylunpaid work. 
In your letter 
• explain why you want to do voluntarylunpaid work at the museum 
• describe some skills and qualities you have that would be useful 
• give details of when you would be available for work
text: This is John and I saw your advertisement in a local magazine for a part-time voluntary job. I would like to share my enthusiasm to work in your museum as a volunteer. Let me explain more.

Currently, I am studying architecture at Concordia University. Since your museum has some exhibitions on ancient architecture and historical monuments, I would like to freely share my knowledge with your visitors. This would be a great opportunity for them to learn more about our history and the architectural developments. I already passed more than twenty credits on various subjects about  Canadian architecture history and how they are affected by  American and  European designs. Consequently, it would be a unique chance for me to keep my understandings fresh and explain them to your audiences.

As a result, I have attached the essential documents to this letter for your reference. In addition, I would like to mention that I will be available in September during the weekends. I am looking forward to hearing from you.
